Visual Continuity

"
Transitioning between two visual states should be clear, smooth and effortless and not confuse the user. A well-designed transition does the heavy lifting and enables the user to clearly understand where their attention should be focused.
"

Share it if you like it

Customary cat!

Hierarchical timing

When building a transition, consider the order and timing of the elements' movement. Ensure that motion supports the information hierarchy, conveying what content is most important by creating a path for the eye to follow.
Google Material design
